question.questionText: Primary Site of Disease

dataElement.longName: Primary Site of Disease Name
dataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the primary anatomic site of disease using a set of values in compliance with the Adverse Event Expedited Reporting System (AdEERS).

valueDomain.longName: Primary Site of Disease Text Name

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.
Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.
Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.
Small tissue projection existing as a cecal diverticulum with a questionable history of vestigial versus specialized organ.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

definition.text: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

classification.name: Common Biorepository Model
classification.preferredDefinition: A common model to contain summary-level details of biorepository / biobank holdings which can be advertised through the OBBR Specimen Resource Locator

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.
A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

definition.text: Peritoneum

classification.name: Common Biorepository Model
classification.preferredDefinition: A common model to contain summary-level details of biorepository / biobank holdings which can be advertised through the OBBR Specimen Resource Locator

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PAIR-ih-toe-NEE-um) The tissue that lines the abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in the abdomen.

definition.text: Pleura

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PLOOR-a) A thin layer of tissue covering the lungs and the wall of the chest cavity to protect and cushion the lungs. A small amount of fluid that acts as a lubricant allows the lungs to move smoothly in the chest cavity during breathing.

definition.text: Prostate

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS)
The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

One of the two organs that excrete the urine. The kidneys are bean-shaped organs (about 11 cm long, 5 cm wide, and 3 cm thick) lying on either side of the vertebral column, posterior to the peritoneum, about opposite the twelfth thoracic and first three lumbar vertebrae. SYN ren, nephros.

definition.text: includes lungs, mediastinum, chest wall, thoracic spine

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.
The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.
Brainstem
An organ that produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys those that are aging. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach. (OCC)
Thyroid

One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova; surrounding this stroma is a more condensed layer of stroma called the tunica albuginea.
The organ located between the esophagus and the small intestine where digestion of food occurs before passing to the small intestine.
The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.
The skeleton of the head including the bones of the face and the bones enclosing the brain.
The largest and strongest bone of the FACE constituting the lower jaw. It supports the lower teeth.
No value exists.

definition.text: Ribs

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum' by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.
No value exists.

classification.name: AIM
classification.preferredDefinition: Annotations and Imaging Markup (AIM) is an information model used to capture information about how images are perceived by human or machine observers that is directly tied to medical images.

definition.text: Radius

classification.name: AIM
classification.preferredDefinition: Annotations and Imaging Markup (AIM) is an information model used to capture information about how images are perceived by human or machine observers that is directly tied to medical images.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A straight line from the center to the perimeter of a circle or from the center to the surface of a sphere.
Ulna
The longest and largest bone of the skeleton, it is situated between the hip and the knee.
The second longest bone of the skeleton. It is located on the medial side of the lower leg, articulating with the FIBULA laterally, the TALUS distally, and the FEMUR proximally.
The bone of the lower leg lateral to and smaller than the tibia. In proportion to its length, it is the most slender of the long bones.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The portion of the colon that connects to the descending colon above and the rectum below.
(AY-nus) The opening of the rectum to the outside of the body.
No value exists.
Ileum
The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.
The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

definition.text: Cervix

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (SER-viks) The lower, narrow end of the uterus that forms a canal between the uterus and vagina.

The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.
A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The dorsal area between the base of the neck and the sacrum.

definition.text: TESTICLE

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.
(doo-ah-DEE-num) The first part of the small intestine.
An external male reproductive organ. It contains a tube called the urethra, which carries semen and urine to the outside of the body.
(FAIR-inks) The hollow tube about 5 inches long that starts behind the nose and ends at the top of the trachea (windpipe) and esophagus (the tube that goes to the stomach).
The nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.
The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.
PERIPHERAL BLOOD
The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
Cerebrum
A tube through which bile passes in and out of the liver.
One of a pair of tubes that extend from the uterus to each of the ovaries. Following ovulation the egg travels down the fallopian tube to the uterus where fertilization may or may not occur.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

question.questionText: Performance Status

dataElement.longName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status Score
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The number or value that determines the value, significance, or extent of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and to carry out daily activities based on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) and the Karnofsky Performance Statuses.

valueDomain.longName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status Score

definition.text: Dead

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Dead.

definition.text: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Moribund, fatal processes progressing rapidly

valueMeaning.longName: 100=Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease

valueMeaning.longName: 1=Symptomatic; fully ambulatory; restricted in physically strenuous activity

definition.text: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

valueMeaning.longName: 20=Very sick, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Very sick, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent

valueMeaning.longName: 2=Symptomatic; ambulatory; capable of self-care; greater than 50% waking hours out of bed

definition.text: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

valueMeaning.longName: 30=Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent

valueMeaning.longName: 3=Symptomatic; limited self-care; greater than 50% waking hours in bed

definition.text: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Disabled, requires special care and assistance

definition.text: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

valueMeaning.longName: 50=Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care

valueMeaning.longName: 60=Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs

valueMeaning.longName: 70=Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work

valueMeaning.longName: 80=Normal activity with effort; some signs or symptoms of disease
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Normal activity with effort; some signs or symptoms of disease

valueMeaning.longName: 90=Able to carry on normal activity; minor signs or symptoms of disease

validValue.description: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

validValue.meaningText: 1=Symptomatic; fully ambulatory; restricted in physically strenuous activity
validValue.description: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

validValue.meaningText: 2=Symptomatic; ambulatory; capable of self-care; >50% waking hours out of bed
validValue.description: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma of the bladder that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed (at original diagnosis or subsequent recurrence or progression) lymphoma, chronic lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL) or solid tumor?

referenceDocument.name: Does the patient have histolo
referenceDocument.doctext: Does the patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed solid malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable for which standard curative or palliative treatments do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Patients with known BRAFv600x mutation: Does patient have known BRAF-V600X mutated, histologically confirmed cancer that is metastatic or unresectable and for which curative or standard therapies do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically documented solid tumors whose disease has progressed following at least one line of standard therapy and/or no standard of treatment exists that has been shown to prolong survival?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a histologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer and is being evaluated and/or treated for cancer at participating sites?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Does the patient have histologically confirmed solid malignancy (excluding lymphoma) that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma of the bladder that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically or cytologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for whom either standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective, or for whom anti-PD-L1/CTLA-4 is appropriate?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC, with incurable advanced or metastatic disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically proven metastatic or locally advanced tumors for which no standard therapy exists, or where standard therapy has failed, or in patients otherwise ineligible for standard therapy, or for an indication that anti-PD-1 therapy has been shown to be effective in studies in HIV-uninfected participants?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have Stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically confirmed non-squamous NSCLC?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or pathologically confirmed diagnosis of peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL) follicular variant or angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL) as per World Health Organization (WHO) 2008 criteria?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed, locally advanced or metastatic predominantly urothelial carcinoma of the bladder, ureter, or urethra that is not amenable to curative surgical treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have pathologically confirmed diagnosis of a solid tumor cancer for which there is no known standard therapy capable of extending life expectancy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed relapsed/refractory ALK+ ALCL (with ALK positivity defined by immunohistochemistry and/or FISH/cytogenetics), MCL, or BCL6+ DLBCL (with BCL6 positivity defined by immunohistochemistry)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has primary oropharynx HNSCC, is disease HPV (-) according to local institutional definition using either p16 immunohistochemistry or HPV testing?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed, relapsed/refractory ALK+ ALCL (with ALK positivity defined by immunohistochemistry and/or FISH/cytogenetics), MCL, or BCL6+ DLBCL (with BCL6 positivity defined by immunohistochemistry from any prior biopsy)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of cancer and is being evaluated and/or treated for cancer at participating sites?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma (ASPS) that is not curable by surgery?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed locally advanced or metastatic Transitional Cell Carcinoma (TCC) which has progressed after standard therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed progressive, metastatic castration resistant prostate adenocarcinoma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or pathologically confirmed malignancy (hematologic or solid tumor) that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard of care therapy does not exist or is no longer effective?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have Stage IV or recurrent/metastatic histologically confirmed non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have invasive cancer in the contralateral breast?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has renal cell cancer associated with HLRCC, is disease metastatic and/or unresectable?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have myelodysplastic syndrome/acute myeloid leukemia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have EHE that contains TAZ-CAMTA1 gene fusion as detected by fusion fluorescent in-situ hybridization (FISH) performed in a central reference laboratory at Cleveland Clinic?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Does pateint have any of the following tumor types: melanoma, bone sarcomas, Soft tissue sarcomas, including angiosarcoma, primary cutaneous leiomyosarcoma, dermatofibrosarcoma protruberans, Leukemias, Myeloid sarcoma, leukemia cutis, and chloroma, Hodgkins Lymphoma or B cell lymphoma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed, gastric carcinoma, including GEJ adenocarcinoma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 33
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known DPD deficiency?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is enrolled in Phase II: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed small cell lung cancer whose disease has relapsed or progressed after greater than or equal to 1 prior therapy, one of which must have been a platinum doublet?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically documented solid tumors whose disease has progressed on standard therapy or for which there is no available standard therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or treatment refractory cancers which are not curable or do not have known palliative measures or treatments that are associated with a survival advantage (as defined by the subject or the physician Investigator)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient's disease recurrent or refractory to standard therapy or remaining treatment options are unlikely to be effective or patient refuses such therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any of the following tumor types: melanoma, bone sarcomas, Soft tissue sarcomas, including angiosarcoma, primary cutaneous leiomyosarcoma, dermatofibrosarcoma protruberans, Leukemias, Myeloid sarcoma, leukemia cutis, and chloroma, Hodgkins Lymphoma or B cell lymphoma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable and for which standard curative or palliative measures do not exist or are no longer effective or for whom CPT-11 treatment would be a viable therapy regimen?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have histologically confirmed solid tumor malignancy that is metastatic or treatment refractory cancers which are not curable or do not have known measures or treatments that are associated with a survival advantage (as defined by the subject or the physician Investigator)?

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior therapy with mTOR inhibitors except for rapalog treatment as part of GVH prophylaxis or treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Has patient received more tha
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received more than 2 lines of therapy beyond corticosteroids with or without calcineurin inhibitors or sirolimus?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received Trastuzumab, Bevacizumab, or nitrosoureas/mitomycin C less than 6 weeks prior to registration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient not received prior therapy with mTOR inhibitors except for rapalog treatment as part of GVH prophylaxis or treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received no more than 1 prior regimen in the platinum resistant setting?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving adjuvant chemoradiation after surgical resection of the primary site of disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received ibrutinib within 2 weeks prior to beginning therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has ovarian cancer and a BRCA mutation, has patient received prior treatment with olaparib per guidelines for standard care treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received at least two prior chemotherapeutic or biologic (e.g., Rituximab alone) regimens and is not currently eligible for standard curative options?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received neoadjuvant or adjuvant therapy within 6 months prior to diagnosis of metastatic disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had less than or equal to 3 lines of prior therapy in the metastatic disease setting?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Patient has not received prior P13K, AKT or mTor inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received at least two prior lines of therapy for mCRPC?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior P13K, AKT,or mTOR inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of prior cytotoxic chemotherapy received at least 28 days prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received one prior systemic chemotherapeutic regimen for management of recurrent, persistent or metastatic carcinoma of the cervix (e.g.; paclitaxel/cisplatin, paclitaxel/cisplatin/bevacizumab)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior ACT infusion within 6 months of study enrollment (cohorts include ACT with TIL, HLA-class I TCR-engineered lymphocytes, HLA-class II TCR-engineered lymphocytes, and CAR-engineered T cells)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received greater than 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for the current malignancy (full dose chemotherapy in conjunction with concurrent radiation therapy will be included in prior therapy)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received one prior systemic chemotherapeutic regimen for management of recurrent, persistent or metastatic carcinoma of the cervix (e.g.; paclitaxel/cisplatin, paclitaxel/cisplatin/Bevacizumab) at least one of which must have contained bevacizumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient currently receiving medications or herbal supplements noted below which cannot be discontinued at least 1 week prior to receiving any protocol treatment or as specified in protocol section 5.3?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received at least one prior line of therapy for mCRPC?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received at least one line of standard systemic treatment for locally advanced or metastatic disease setting of the respective tumor type?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior platinum based chemotherapy?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

question.questionText: Has prior ACT therapy been completed and residual disease has been documented by either radiographic progression or active disease observed on biopsy (i.e. hematologic or solid tumor malignancy must be deemed active by the treating investigator)?

instruction.text: The investigator may deem that the disease is active on the basis of a pre-treatment biopsy demonstrating viable tumor cells or clinical progression of disease (ie RECIST progression is not required).

dataElement.longName: Agent Intervention Disease or Disorder Status Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions related to the use of agents that produce an effect, or that are intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient, and the status of the patient's disease.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: If patient is in the dose exp
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is in the dose expansion portion ONLY, does patient have: 1) progression of disease with erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) tumors must be EGFR T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment (If EGFR-T790M status is unknown, patient may consent for trial for biopsy and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of the initial biopsy for the trial: patients who test positive for EGFR T790M by central testing will be ineligible for the dose expansion), 3) be treatment nave for 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (CO-1686 and AZD9291) and mTOR inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is on the dose expansion portion, does patient have: 1) have a tumor which is EGFR-T790M positive using central genotyping (if EGFR-T790M status is unknown, patients may consent for central EGFR T790M testing as part of screening for the trial; patients who test negative for EGFR T790M by central genotyping will be ineligible), and 2) be treatment nave to T790M-directed EGFR TKI (e.g. AZD9291, rociletinib, etc.)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: For the dose expansion portion ONLY, does patient have: 1) have progression of disease with erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) tumors must be EGFR-T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment (If EGFR-T790M status is unknown patients may consent for trial for biopsy and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of initial biopsy for trial; patients who test positive for EGFR T790M by central testing will be ineligible for the dose expansion), 3) be treatment nave to 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (CO-1686 and AZD9291) and EGFR monoclonal antibodies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is in the dose expansion portion ONLY, does patient have: 1) progression of disease with erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) tumors must be EGFR T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment (If EGFR-T790M status is unknown, patient may consent for trial for biopsy and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of the initial biopsy for the trial: patients who test positive for EGFR T790M by central testing will be ineligible for the dose expansion), 3) be treatment nave for 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (CO-1686 and osimertinib (AZD9291)) and mTOR inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has prior ACT therapy been completed and residual disease has been documented by either radiographic progression or active disease observed on biopsy (i.e. hematologic or solid tumor malignancy must be deemed active by the treating investigator)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has NSCLC (Cohort 1) was there evidence of radiologic or clinical disease progression during previous treatment with systemic PD-1 directed therapy and/or patient was deemed not to have derived clinical benefit from PD-1 directed treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: For patient registered to Dose Expansion Cohort A, does patient have: 1) progression of disease on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) biopsy of tumor taken after progression on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib must be EGFR-T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment If EGFR-T790M status is unknown patients may consent for trial and for biopsy, and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of initial biopsy for trial., 3) be treatment nave to 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (rociletinib, HM61713 and AZD9291) and EGFR monoclonal antibodies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: For Dose Expansion Cohort D: patient must have: 1) tumor that harbors an EGFR Exon 20 insertion by a CLIA certified test, and 2) have progressive disease on or aftter platinum based chemotherapy, and 3) be treatment nave to both EGFR-TKI and EGFR monoclonal antibody? Does For patient registered to Dose Expansion Cohort A, does patient have: 1) progression of disease on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) biopsy of tumor taken after progression on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib must be EGFR-T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment (if EGFR-T790M status is unknown patients may consent for trial and for biopsy, and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of initial biopsy for trial), and 3) be treatment nave to 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (rociletinib, HM61713 and AZD9291) and EGFR monoclonal antibodies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: For patient registered to Dose Expansion Cohort A, does patient have: 1) progression of disease on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib as last previous systemic treatment, 2) biopsy of tumor taken after progression on erlotinib, gefitinib or afatinib must be EGFR-T790M negative confirmed by central testing prior to treatment (if EGFR-T790M status is unknown patients may consent for trial and for biopsy, and testing for EGFR T790M will be performed as part of initial biopsy for trial), and 3) be treatment nave to 3rd generation EGFR-TKI (rociletinib, HM61713 and AZD9291) and EGFR monoclonal antibodies?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: Does patient have measurable disease?

instruction.text: Leukemia and Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma patients must have measurable disease according to the revised response criteria for malignant lymphorma.

dataElement.longName: Patient Measurable Disease Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient has measurable disease as defined by RECIST v1.1.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have measurable
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease by RECIST 1.1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease according to RECIST criteria for patients with solid tumors and modified RECIST criteria as described by Byrne and Novak for patients with malignant pleural or peritoneal mesothelioma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable or evaluative disease, as defined by RECIST 1.1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable or evaluable/non-measurable disease per RECIST 1.1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease according to RECIST criteria for patients with solid tumors and modified RECIST criteria as described by Byrne and Novak for patients with malignant pleural or mesothelioma?

referenceDocument.name: COG CRF Text 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease according to RECIST 1.1 and have relapsed or become refractory to conventional therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease by RECIST v1.1 with at least one measurable target lesion?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have disease measurable by RECIST v1.1 or other tumor-specific criteria or disease assessable by physical exam or other methods if not measurable by RECIST?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have radiographically measurable disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable GIST as defined by RECIST 1.1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease outside of biopsy site present per RECIST criteria?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is enrolled in Phase II: Does patient have measurable disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 or evaluable disease with bone metastases demonstrated by Tc99 Bone Scan?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease per RECIST version 1.1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease per RECIST guidelines?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have evaluable or measurable disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have measurable disease by RECIST 1.1 by CT Scan or MRI 28 days prior to start of protocol therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is randomized to the Phase 2 portion, does patient have measurable disease?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have tumor lesio
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have tumor lesion readily accessible for biopsy per the investigator's discretion?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is disease suitable for assessment by pre- and post-biopsies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had core biopsy within 7 days prior to day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have tumor lesion safely accessible for biopsy per the investigator's discretion?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have tumors deemed easily accessible for biopsies with low likelihood of complication?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have tumors determined to be easily accessible for biopsy (e.g. pleural-based lesions, peripheral lymph nodes, soft tissue metastases, large liver metastases, etc.)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Did patient have biopsy in permissible site including extremities: upper (including shoulder) and lower (including hip) and/or Trunk: Body wall?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: Patient has not received prior anti-PD-1 or ant-PD-L1 therapy after ACT and before study atezolizumab (MPDL3280A) administration?

instruction.text: There is no limit to the number of lines of prior therapy. Prior anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy and other immunotherapies are allowed.

dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient meets the antibody therapy criteria in order to participate in a clinical trial.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways?

referenceDocument.name: Has received prior therapy wi
referenceDocument.doctext: Has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, ziv-aflibercept or anti-CTLA-4 antibody (including ipilimumab or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with any therapy on the PD-1/PD-L1 axis or anti-CTLA-4 inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody, or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Patient has not received prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2 antibody?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have disease that is documented to be refractory to at least one PD1/PD-L1 inhibitor, defined as disease progression following at least 2 infusions of the same drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with any PARP inhibitor or any anti-PD-1/anti-PD-L1 antibody?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Has bisphosphonate, or RANKL antibody therapy been initiated or the dose/regimen adjusted within 30 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1 or anti-CTLA-4 therapeutic antibody orpathway-targeting agents?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 antibody, anti-PD 1 antibody or anti-PDL1 antibody?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-PD-1, or anti-PD-L1 therapeutic antibody or pathway-targeting agents are following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Patient has not received prior anti-PD-1 or ant-PD-L1 therapy after ACT and before study atezolizumab (MPDL3280A) administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with any therapy on the PD-1/PD-L1 axis or anti-CTLA-4 inhibitors, unless enrolling the urothelial carcinoma with previous checkpoint inhibition therapy expansion cohort?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with any anti-PD-1 blocking therapies or HDACi, or anti-CTLA-4 antibody, CD137 agonist or other immune activating therapy such as anti-CD 40 antibody within the last 3 months of enrollment in the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Has received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CD137, or ziv-aflibercept?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD1 or anti-CTLA4 therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has had prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior treatment with anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 orpathway-targeting agents?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient has prior exposure to immune mediated therapy including anti-CTLA-4 agent, but excluding therapeutic anticancer vaccines and anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy in NSCLC patients?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had prior exposure to immune mediated therapy including anti-CTLA-4 agent, but excluding therapeutic anticancer vaccines and anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 therapy in NSCLC patients?

referenceDocument.name: theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient greater than or equal to 15 weeks since prior anti-CD137 or anti-CTLA-4 (including ipilimumab or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or checkpoint pathways)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior therapy with an anti-PD-1, anti-PD-L1, anti-PD-L2, anti-CTLA-4 antibody or any other antibody or drug specifically targeting T-cell co-stimulation or immune checkpoint pathways?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received checkpoint inhibitors such as anti-CTLA-4 or anti-PD1/PD-L1 and for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks prior to C1D1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior anti-CTLA-4 have a minimum of 12 weeks elapsed from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody?

referenceDocument.name: Are all treatment-related tox
referenceDocument.doctext: Are all treatment-related toxicities CTCAE v4 grade less than or equal to 1 (except alopecia) at the time of enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Are all prior treatment-related toxicities CTCAE v4 less than or equal to grade 1 (except alopecia) at the time of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Have all acute, clinically significant treatment-related toxicity from prior therapy, except for alopecia, resolved to Grade less than or equal to 1 prior to study entry?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Have all toxicities of prior therapy (except alopecia or long-standing grade 2 neuropathy that has been discussed with study PI) resolved to grade less than or equal to 1 as per CTCAE v4.0?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has prior treatment-related toxicity resolved to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline with exception of alopecia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Have all ACT related toxicities resolved to grade 1 with the exception of alopecia, vitiligo and endocrine abnormalities requiring replacement therapy which may be grade 2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any unresolved toxicities from prior therapy greater than CTCAE grade 1 at the time of starting study treatment with the exception of alopecia and grade 2 platinum-therapy related neuropathy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Are all prior treatment-related toxicities CTCAE-v4 grade less than or equal to 1 (except alopecia) at the time of enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Has prior treatment-related toxicity resolved to less than or equal to Grade 1 or baseline with exception of alopecia and permanent grade less than or equal to 2 toxicities related to prior immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment (e.g. PD-1/PD-L1, CTLA-4, CD40, LAG3) treatment with the review and approval by the Lead PI?

referenceDocument.name: Were the interventions or pro
referenceDocument.doctext: Were the interventions or procedures discontinued accordingly?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received hydroxyurea or glucocorticoids for suppression of leukocytosis, have these agents been discontinued at least 24 hours prior to initiation of therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is enrolled on Phase I portion, has prior EGFR-TKIs (except erlotinib) been discontinued at least 7 days prior to initiation of erlotinib and Onalespib?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient been off other anit-cancer therapy, including ACT, for 28 days prior to study administration of atexolizumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient requires treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab) can it be discontinued before treatment with atezolizumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient requires treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab), is patient able to discontinue it before treatment with atezolizumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require treatment with a RANKL inhibitor (e.g. denosumab) which cannot be discontinued before treatment with atezolizumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is Zubrod performance status 0, 1 or 2 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60%)?

referenceDocument.name: Is ECOG performance status 0
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0 or 1 and has an estimated life expectancy of greater than 3 months?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex-1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1, or 2 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0 or 1 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 70%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1 or 2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0 or 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0 or 1 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 80%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1, or 2 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 50%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, or 1 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status less than or equal to 2 (Karnofsky or Lansky greater than or equal to 70%)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1 or 2 (Patients greater than or equal to 16 years of age must have a Karnofsky performance level of greater than or equal to 70%) and children less than 16 years old must have a Lansky performance of greater than equal to 70%?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1 or 2 or Karnofsky greater than 50% (if greater than or equal to 16 years of age); or children less than 16 years old must have a Lansky performance of greater than or equal to 50%?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1 or 2 or Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60% if patient is greater than 16 years of age; or Lansky greater than or equal to 60% if patient is less than or equal to 16 years old?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status less than or equal to 1 or Karnofsky greater than or equal to 70%?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is ECOG performance status 0, 1, or 2 (Karnofsky or Lansky greater than or equal to 70%)?

question.questionText: Is pre-study absolute neutrophil count greater than or equal to 1,000/mcL?

dataElement.longName: Laboratory Procedure Absolute Neutrophil Count Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a medical procedure has been performed that involves testing a sample of blood for the absolute neutrophil count, the real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils and is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

question.questionText: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL (greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL for patients with hematologic malignancies?

dataElement.longName: Laboratory Procedure Platelet Count Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether a medical procedure has been performed that involves testing a sample of blood for the platelet count, the real number of irregularly shaped disk like cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Is pre-study platelet count g
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100 x 10^9/L?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75 X 10^9/L?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 150,000/mcl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 50,000/mcL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL unless due to marrow involvement by lymphoma in which case a platelet count of greater than or equal to 30,000/mcL will be used?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than 100,000/mcl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000/mcl, or recovery to baseline count?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL (greater than or equal to 50,000/mcL for patients with hematologic malignancies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl, independent of transfusion for at least 7 days prior to screening and independent of growth factor support for at least 14 days prior to screening?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 75,000/mcL, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 50,000 cells/mm3 if marrow plasmacytosis is less than 50% OR platelet count is greater than or equal to 30,000 cells/mm3 if marrow plasmacytosis is greater than or equal to 50%?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mm3?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study platelet count greater than or equal to 100,000/mcl within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

question.questionText: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 g/dl?

dataElement.longName: Hematology Hemoglobin Assessment Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator whether there was a hematology assessment for hemoglobin, the red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Is pre-study hemoglobin great
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl OR greater than or equal to 5.6 mmol/L?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 g/dl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 90 g/L (or 9 g/dl)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dl?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than 9 g/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 g/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9.0 g/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dl and patient has not had blood transfusions in the 28 days prior to entry/randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dL with no blood transfusion in the past 28 days?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 g/dl, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl, independent of transfusion for at least 7 days prior to screening and independent of growth factor support for at least 14 days prior to screening?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dl within 4 weeks prior to administration of study treatment and patient has not had blood transfusions (packed red blood cells and platetet transfusions) in the past 28 days?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl without transfusion for at least 7 days prior to screening?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 8 g/dL within 2 weeks of the initiation of treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl (patients may be transfused to this level)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dl within 4 weeks prior to administration of study treatment and patient has not had blood transfusions (packed red blood cells and platelet transfusions) in the past 28 days?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dl within 28 days prior to administration of study treatment and patient has not had blood transfusions (packed red blood cells and platelet transfusions) in the past 28 days?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

question.questionText: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled)?

dataElement.longName: Laboratory Procedure Within Clinical Study Protocol Upper Limit of Normal Total Bilirubin Measurement Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to the top value of the range for total bilirubin falling within parameters set forth by the guidelines for a clinical trial.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x the upper limit of normal for the institution?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than 1.5 ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Is pre study serum bilirubin
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin within normal institutional limits?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, with the exception of less than 2.9 mg/dL for patients with Gilbert's disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than 2 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal for the institution?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 X upper limit of normal (ULN); or less than 3 x institutional ULN for Gilbert's syndrome or HIV protease inhibitors; or less than 5 x ULN and direct bilirubin less than 0.7 mg/dL for patients on atazanvir containing HIV regimen?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR is direct bilirubin within normal range if pre-study total bilirubin greater than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal, less than or equal 3.0 x upper limit of normal if due to Gilbert's syndrome or hemolysis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study total bilrubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal of patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin below institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or if patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, unless Gilbert's syndrome or disease infiltration of the liver is present?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL (except patients with Gilbert Syndrome, who can have total bilirubin less than 3.0 mg/dL)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x local institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) OR if total bilirubin is elevated due Gilbert's disease or disease-related hemolysis then is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 x local institutional ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study serum bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (with the exception of those with Gilbert syndrome)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome ALT less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (patients with Gilbert's syndrome may have serum bilirubin greater than 1.5 x upper limit of normal)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 3 institutional upper limit of normal in the presence of liver metastases or Gilberts Syndrome (unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 44
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled), within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL unless due to Gilbert's syndrome, hemolysis, or ineffective hematopoiesis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome; ALT less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or if patient has known Gilbert's disease or similar syndrome with slow conjugation of bilirubin is total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 mg/dL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to the institution's upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal (patients with Gilbert's syndrome may have direct bilirubin more than 1.5 x upper limit of normal)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 33
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 ULN for subjects with documented Gilberts syndrome or less than 3.0 ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin level suggests an extra-hepatic source of elevation)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal in the presence of liver metastases or Gilbert's Syndrome (unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, except for patients with Gilbert syndrome?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum total bilirubin less than or equal to upper limit of normal (ULN) OR direct bilirubin less than or equal to ULN for patients with total bilirubin levels greater than ULN; (except patients with Gilbert's Syndrome, who must have a total bilirubin less than 3.0 mg/dL)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum bilirubin within normal limits (WNL) or less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN in patients with liver metastases; or total bilirubin less than or equal to 3.0 x ULN with direct bilirubin WNL in patients with documented Gilberts Syndrome?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 ULN for patients with documented Gilberts syndrome or less than 3.0 ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin level suggests an extra-hepatic source of elevation)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if patient is know to have liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (less than 2.0 x ULN for subjects with documented Gilbert's syndrome or less than 3.0 x ULN for subjects for whom the indirect bilirubin levels suggests an extrahepatic source of elevation)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 43
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR greater than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal is allowed if direct bilirubin is within normal range?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 45
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (however, patients with known Gilbert disease who have serum bilirubin level less than or equal to 3 X ULN may be enrolled), within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (except patients with Gilberts syndrome who can have total bilirubin less than 3 mg/dl)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal if patient is know to have liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 47
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 46
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study total bilirubin within normal institutional limits OR if patient has confirmed Gilberts syndrome is total bilirubin less than or equal to 2.0 x ULN?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

question.questionText: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver involvement?

dataElement.longName: Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services for any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting of measurement of serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase or alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES
