referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal if liver involvement?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST and ALT less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with metastatic liver disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study ALT (SGPT) less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), OR less than 5 x ULN in the presence of liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study ALT (SGPT) or AST (if available at center) less than 2.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN), OR less than 5 x ULN in the presence of liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than 5 x upper limit of normal in patients with Gilbert's disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver involvement?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal in patients with Gilbert's disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST and ALT less than 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 2 x upper limit of normal or less than 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver involvement?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 2 x upper limit of normal or less than 5 x upper limit of normal if liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal (AST and/or ALT less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver involvement)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver involvement?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST and ALT less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (AST and/or ALT less than or equal to 3 x ULN for patients with liver involvement)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 5 institutional upper limit of normal in the presence of liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study SGPT (ALT) or SGOT (AST) less than or equal to 2.5 x the upper limit of normal in the absence of hepatic metastases; SGPT (ALT) less than or equal to 3 x ULN or SGOT (AST) less than or equal to 5 x ULN in the presence of hepatic metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study ALT less than or equal to 3.0 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 43
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT), ALT (SGPT) and alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with known hepatic metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 2 x upper limit of normal or less than 5 x upper limit of normal for patients known to have liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5.0 x institutional upper limit of normal (only if elevated LFTs are due to disease)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 45
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 3 x upper limit of normal or less than to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 47
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than 2 x upper limit of normal or less than 5 x upper limit of normal for patients known to have liver metastasest?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study aspartate transaminase (AST) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 46
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault or creatinine less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 44
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal if no demonstrable liver metastases or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x institutional upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 48
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 49
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 50
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Is pre-study serum creatinine
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min and less than 60 mL/min (Cockroft-Gault)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN OR Measured or calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for subject with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 X institutional ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to twice the upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (less than or equal to 133 umol/L) OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or a calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min (Cockcroft-Gault method) for patients receiving combination of cisplatin and pemetrexed and greater than or equal to 45 mL/min for patients receiving pemetrexed?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL using the modified Cockcroft-Gault formula?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than 50 mL/min using Cockroft-Gault equation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or a calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 (Cockcroft-Gault method) for patients receiving combination of cisplatin and pemetrexed and greater than or equal to 45 ml/min/1.73 m2 for patients receiving pemetrexed?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (less than or equal to 120 umol/L) OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (eGFR) for patients with creatinine levels above the upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (eGFR) appropriate to race for patients with creatinine levels above the upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min by either measured or calculated clearance?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 1.5 mg/dL (equal to 132 umol/L) OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.0 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.0 X institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits for age OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 33
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine below institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study BSA-Normalized creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 43
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance, estimated GFR, greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2 (Cockcroft-Gault)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits for age OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 47
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min based on either Cockroft-Gault estimate or based on urine collection (12 or 24 hours)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 44
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 45
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 46
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 50
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (using the Cockcroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 52
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 me2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 51
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 54
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 x institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 53
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 by either Cockcroft- Gault formula or analysis normal serum creatinine based on age?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 48
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 49
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min using Cockroft-Gault equation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 55
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance by MDRD (CrCl) greater than 50 ml/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 58
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2by either Cockcroft-Gault formula or 24-hour urine collection analysis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 57
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN or creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than or equal to 70mL/min/1.73m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 56
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 60
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 73
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gaul or creatinine less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 59
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN and concurrent creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 50mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine greater than 1.5 x ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 63
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, or measured creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault method (confirmation of creatinine clearance is only required when creatinine is greater than 1.5 x institutional ULN)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 68
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with serum creatinine greater than 1.5 x higher than institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 62
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study BSA-Normalized creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (using Cockcroft-Gault CrCl)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 65
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 (calculated using the CKD-EPI equation or Cockgroft-Gault formula) for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 72
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 (calculated using the CKD-EPI equation or Cockgroft-Gault formula) for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 64
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 74
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine within normal institutional limits OR calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 69
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 70
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 66
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN OR calculated or measured creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 71
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 67
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 61
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to the upper limit of institutional normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 78
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 79
referenceDocument.doctext: Is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 75
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 50 mL/min?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 77
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than 50 mL/min using Cockroft-Gault equation or 24-hour urine sampling?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 76
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault or creatinine less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.3 X institutional ULN? Patients receiving anticoagulation treatment may be allowed to participate with INR established within the therapeutic range prior to randomization.

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study Prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.2 x institutional ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN unless subject is receiving anticoagulant therapy not requiring laboratory monitoring as long as PT or PTT is within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants?

referenceDocument.name: Is pre-study INR less than or
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or PT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal seconds above control unless patient is currently receiving warfarin therapy for the treatment or prevention of venous thrombosis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.4?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International Normalized Ratio (INR) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test greater than or equal to 1.3 x the laboratory upper limit of normal within 7 days prior to the first dose of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study INR less than 2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study PTT less than or equal to 40 seconds unless due to lupus coagulant?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study PT/INR and PTT less than 1.3 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study prothrombin time or INR less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 2?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) and PT less than or equal to 1.2 X ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study prothrombin time or INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.3 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR, aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study PT/INR and PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study coagulation parameters within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed or except patients on anticoagulation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is not receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, are pre-study INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study INR less than or equal to 1.4 unless the patient is receiving therapeutic doses of Coumadin?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International Normalized Ratio (INR) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test greater than or equal to 1.5 x the laboratory upper limit of normal within 7 days prior to the first dose of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study International normalized ratio ((NR) and aPartial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study aPTT and PT less than to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.5 upper limit of normal (ULN), OR International normalized ratio (INR) less than 1.5?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR and aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study prothrombin time (PT)/International normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 X institutional ULN unless patient is on anticoagulant therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: If receiving patient is receiving warfarin, is INR less than or equal to 3.0 without any evidence of active bleeding within 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study International normalized ratio (INR) and aPartial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Is pre-study prothrombin time (PT) or partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than 1.5 upper limit of normal (ULN), OR International normalized ratio (INR) less than 1.5?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is receiving warfarin, is INR less than or equal to 3.0 without any evidence of active bleeding within 14 days prior to first dose of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study aPTT and PT greater than or equal to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study aPTT and PT less than or equal to 1.2 x upper limit of normal?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study coagulation parameters (INR and aPTT) within 1.25 x institutional upper limit of normal, unless a Lupus anti-coagulant has been confirmed or except pateints on anticoagulants?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Are pre-study international normalized ratio (INR) or prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) or activated PTT (aPTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: If required, will warfarin use be within the parameters described in section 5.5.1 of protocol?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving full anti-coagulant therapy with Coumadin?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require concurrent use of anticoagulation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is receiving therapeutic anticoagulation, such as low-molecular-weight heparin or warfarin, are they on a stable dose?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy including, heparin or low molecular weight heparin, warfarin, clopidogrel, ibuprofen and other NSAIDS, tirofiban, and other anticoagulants, drugs, or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is on full dose anticoaugulation, has patient been on a stable dose for at least 14 days?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving anticoagulation or anti-platelet therapy including, include heparin or low molecular weight heparin, warfarin, clopidogrel, ibuprofen and other NSAIDS, tirofiban, and other anticoagulants, drug or herbal supplements that affect platelet function?

referenceDocument.name: Does patient, women of childb
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after the last dose of drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex -3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry and for duration of study participation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and up to 90 days following completion of therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is male and sexually active, patient agrees to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation and for 31 weeks after the last dose of investigational product?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months after completion of study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation and for 31 weeks after the last dose of investigational product?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after completion of MLN8237 administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is male and is sexually active with a women of child bearing potential, patient agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation and for 31 weeks after the last dose of investigational product?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Does female patient of childbearing potential, agree to use an adequate method of contraception throughout the study and for up to 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, woman of childbearing potential and men, agree to use two forms of contraception, prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 31 weeks after the last dose nivolumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use two highly effective forms of contraception (i.e., barrier contraception and one other method of contraception) at least 4 weeks prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for at least 12 months post-treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 3 months after the last dose of drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use highly effective contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months after completion of study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use highly effective contraception (as per section 3.3.11) prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months after completion of study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after the last CDX-011 (glembatumumab vedotin) dose?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 6 months after the last dose of MLN0128 and AZD9291?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men with female partner of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation and for 4 months after the last dose of drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men with partners of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 2 months after completion of study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after the last dose AZD1775 and belinostat administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception, as listed in protocol, prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months for women and 6 months for men following the date of the last dose of AZD9291 and/or necitumumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months for women and 6 months for men following the date of the last dose of AZD9291 and/or navitoclax?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 6 months after study completion?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of study drugs?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal contraception not allowed) prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of study drug administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 23 weeks for women and 31 weeks for men after stopping nivolumab?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after completion of AT13387 (onalespib) administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception during treatment with MM-938 for 90 days following the final dose of Veliparib and MM-398?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of IPdR administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use 1 highly effective method of contraception and 1 additional effective (barrier) method, at the same time, from the time of signing the informed consent through 90 days (or longer, as mandated by local labeling [eg. USPI, SmPC, etc]) after the last dose of study drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and up to 90 days following completion of ibrutinib administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception during treatment with MM-398 and for 90 days following the final dose of Veliparib and MM-398?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 33
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of child-bearing potential and men, agree to practice 1 highly effective method of contraception and 1 additional effective (barrier) method of contraception, at the same time, from the time of signing the informed consent through 90 days (or longer, as mandated by local labeling [eg, USPI, SmPC, etc;]) after the last dose of study drug, or agree to completely abstain from heterosexual intercourse?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of child-bearing potential and men must agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; abstinence) prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for at least 5 months (150 days) after the last dose of study agent (men must also agree to use adequate contraception for at least 5 months (150 days) after completion of atezolizumab and/or ABT-888 administration)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use two highly effective forms of contraception for the duration of study participation and for 6 weeks after completion of olaparib and cediranib administration (12 weeks for men)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception, prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 5 months after completion of study drug administration (completion of atezolizumab administration)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 23 weeks for women and 31 weeks for men after last dose of investigational drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 3 months after completion of study drugs (4 months for men)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 weeks after dosing with selumetinib ceases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 5 months (150 days) after the last dose of study agent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception during study participation, and for 6 months after completion of bevacizumab therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 6 months after the last dose of study agent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 45
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 weeks after dosing with AZD6244 ceases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 44
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 6 months following participation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 43
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 150 days after the last dose of study agent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 150 days after the last dose of study agent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 48
referenceDocument.doctext: Does female patient childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 5 months after the last dose of drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 51
referenceDocument.doctext: Does female patient childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 7 months after the last dose of drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 52
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 5 months(150 days) after the last dose of study agent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 46
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 weeks after dosing with AZD6244 ceases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 47
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception, prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 5 months (150 days) after completion of study drug administration (completion of atezolizumab administration)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 50
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use highly effective contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 120 days after last dose of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 49
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 4 months after completion of olaparib and ramucirumab administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 60
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months after completion of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 53
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 180 days after the last dose of paclitaxel?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 61
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 5 months for women and 7 months for men after last dose of study drug?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 64
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men with partners of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception (barrier method of birth control, or abstinence; hormonal contraception is not allowed due to drug-drug interactions which can render hormonal contraceptives ineffective) prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of study drug administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 65
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, during study participation, and for 3 months after completion of Olaparib and Ramucirumab administration?

referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control, abstinence) prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of IPdR administration?

referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men with partners of childbearing potential, agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal contraception not allowed) prior to study entry, for duration of study participation and for 4 months after completion of study drug administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 58
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of child bearing potential and men, agree to use two forms of contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; abstinence; sterilization) prior to the study, for the duration of study participation, and for 3 months after completion of administration of Aza-TdC?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 69
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of child-bearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of the study and 6 months after completion of anetumab ravtansine or MK-3475 (pembrolizumab) administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 66
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is female of childbearing potential uses hormonal contraceptive, does patient agree to use an additional barrier method of contraception while on study treatment and for 30 days after discontinuation of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 70
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men and their partners who are sexually active, agree to use two highly effective forms of contraception in combination (see olaparib 1B page 161-162 for acceptable methods) for the duration of study participation and for 3 months after completion of olaparib and cediranib administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 68
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, women of childbearing potential and men, agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry and for the duration of study participation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 67
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient, men and women of childbearing potential agree to use adequate contraception prior to study entry, for the duration of study participation, and for 4 months after completion of administration of either agent?

referenceDocument.name: Has patient had a prior monoc
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had a prior monoclonal antibody within 4 weeks prior to study Day 1 or who has not recovered (i.e., less than or equal to Grade 1 or at baseline) from AEs due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from end of monoclonal antibody therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from end of monoclonal therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4, has it been a minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and more than 6 weeks from the last dose, and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed at least 3 half-lives of the antibody or 6 weeks ago?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of a monoclonal antibody at least 3 half-lives prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of a monoclonal antibody at least 30 days prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 antibody, was last dose greater than 6 weeks previously and there is no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 antibody (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements are met: Minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and greater than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior treatment with anti-CTLA-4 are the following requirements met: Minimum of 12 weeks from the first dose of anti-CTLA-4 and greater than 6 weeks from the last dose and no history of severe immune-related adverse effects from anti-CTLA-4 (NCI CTCAE Grade 3 and 4)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior monoclonal antibody therapy, was it completed more than 6 weeks ago (or 3 half-lives of the antibody whichever is shorter) prior to enrollment on protocol (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any monoclonal antibody therapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received herbal therapy intended as anticancer therapy within 1 week prior to randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Is patient taking concurrent
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient taking concurrent herbal supplements (including, but not limited to, St. John's wort, kava, ephedra [ma huang], ginkgo biloba, dehydroepiandrosterone [DHEA], yohimbe, saw palmetto, or ginseng) while on study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient used natural herbal products or other complementary alternative medications (CAM) or "folk remedies" within one week of starting study and will continue using them concurrently while participating on this study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient taking concurrent herbal supplements (including, but not limited to, cannabis, St. John's wort, kava, ephedra [ma huang], ginkgo biloba, dehydroepiandrosterone [DHEA], yohimbe, saw palmetto, or ginseng) while on study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient currently using natural herbal products or other complementary alternative medications (CAM) or folk remedies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving vitamin E supplementation?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received herbal therapy, intended as anticancer therapy, within 1 week prior to cycle 1, day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient using (currently) natural herbal products or other folk remedies?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received prior herbal therapy was last dose more than 1 week prior to cycle 1, day 1?

referenceDocument.name: COG CRF Text 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received herbal preparations during the indicated time period

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient currently taking natural herb products or other complementary alternative medications or if used previously, patients must have at least 1-week washout and must stop using them while participating in this study?

referenceDocument.name: ABTC - 1602 Question
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received herbal or non-traditional medications while receiving AMG 232 therapy within 30 days prior to start of treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving, or is intended to receive ongoing treatment with: herbal remedies (e.g., St. Johns wort), or strong inhibitors or inducers of P-glycoprotein (Pgp) or breast cancer resistance protein 1 (Bcrp1)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patients medication list such as herbal medicines (e.g., St. Johns wort), vitamins, and supplements, been reviewed before starting first dose of AMG 232?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has taken any herbal medicines (e.g., St. Johns wort), vitamins, and supplements within the 30 days prior to receiving the first dose of AMG232 has continued use, if applicable, been reviewed by the Principal Investigator?

question.questionText: If patient has asymptomatic untreated CNS disease have all of the following criteria been met: no more than 3 lesions, less than or equal to 1 cm in size each, evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS, no metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10 mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm), no history of intracranial hemorrhage or spinal cord hemorrhage, no ongoing requirement for dexamethasone for CNS disease; patients ona stable dose of anticonvulsants are permitted, and no neurosurgical resection or brain biopsy within 28 days prior to Cycle1, Day1?

referenceDocument.name: If patient has asymptomatic u
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic untreated CNS disease are all of the following criteria met: Evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS:; No metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10 mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm); No history of intracranial hemorrhage or spinal cord hemorrhage; No ongoing requirement for dexamethasone for CNS disease; patients ona stable dose of anticonvulsants are permitted; No neurosurgical resection or brain biopsy within 28 days prior to Cycle1, Day1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic untreated CNS disease are all of the following criteria are met: Evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS,; No metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10 mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm); No history of intracranial hemorrhage or spinal cord hemorrhage; No ongoing requirement for dexamethasone for CNS disease; patients on a stable dose of anticonvulsants are permitted; No neurosurgical resection or brain biopsy within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic untreated CNS disease have all of the following criteria been met: no more than 3 lesions, less than or equal to 1 cm in size each, evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS, no metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10 mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm), no history of intracranial hemorrhage or spinal cord hemorrhage, no ongoing requirement for dexamethasone for CNS disease; patients ona stable dose of anticonvulsants are permitted, and no neurosurgical resection or brain biopsy within 28 days prior to Cycle1, Day1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have at least one measurable CNS lesion that is asymptomatic, untreated, and does not require local therapy at the time of enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has untreated brain metastases, is patient clinically asymptomatic and stable?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

question.questionText: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases are all of the criteria listed above met as well as the following: Radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNS-directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS-directed therapy and the screening radiographic study; No stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1; Screening CNS radiographic study greater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases, have all of the criteria listed above been met as well as the following: radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNSdirected therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNSdirected therapy and the screening radiographic study, no stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1; and screening CNS radiographic studygreater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases, have all of the criteria listed above been met as well as the following: radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNS? directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS? directed therapy and the screening radiographic study, no stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1; and screening CNS radiographic studygreater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: If patient has asymptomatic t
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases are all of the criteria listed above met as well as the following: Radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNS-directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS-directed therapy and the screening radiographic study; No stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1; Screening CNS radiographic study greater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids.

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has central nervous system (CNS) metastases is it inactive, defined as: no signs of cerebral edema after successful definitive treatment of brain metastases (surgical resection, whole brain irradiation, stereotactic radiation therapy, or a combination of these) with stable or improved radiographic appearance on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan at least 1 month after completion of treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases are all of the criteria listed above met as well as the following: Radiographic demonstration of clinical stability upon the completion of CNS directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS directed therapy and the screening radiographic study; no stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to randomization; and screening CNS radiographic study greater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic treated CNS metastases are all of the criteria listed above met as well as the following: Radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNS-directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS-directed therapy and radiographic screening for the current study; No stereotactic radiation or whole-brain radiation within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1; Screening CNS radiographic study greater than or equal to 4 weeks from completion of radiotherapy and greater than or equal to 2 weeks from discontinuation of corticosteroids

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has central nervous system (CNS) metastases is it inactive, defined as: symptoms of brain metastases after successful definitive treatment of brain metastases (surgical resection, whole brain irradiation, stereotactic radiation therapy, or a combination of these) with stable or improved radiographic appearance on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan at least 1 month after completion of treatment?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: If patient has eczema, psoriasis, lichen simplex chronicus of vitiligo with dermatologic manifestations only (e.g., patients with psoriatic arthritis would be excluded) does patient meet the following conditions: Patients with psoriasis must have a baseline ophthalmologic exam to rule out ocular manifestations Rash must cover less than 10% of body surface area (BSA). Disease is well controlled at baseline and only requiring low potency topical steroids (e.g., hydrocortisone 2.5%, hydrocortisone butyrate 0.1%, flucinolone 0.01%, desonide 0.05%, aclometasone dipropionate 0.05%). No acute exacerbations of underlying condition within the last 12 months (not requiring psoralen plus ultraviolet A radiation [PUVA], methotrexate, retinoids, biologic agents, oral calcineurin inhibitors; high potency or oral steroids?

dataElement.longName: Person Dermatologic Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to any abnormal condition having to do with the skin or the practice of dermatology.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

question.questionText: If patient is HIV-positive are the following criteria met: patient is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART), there is no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and has an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests?

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have a history o
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of HIV infection?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have poorly controlled HIV?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) does patient have the following: a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART), no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, a CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based test?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has a known history of testing positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or known acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) are the following criteria met: patient is generally healthy from an HIV perspective and on a stable antiretroviral regimen for greater than 6 months, no AIDS-defining conditions in the past 12 months other than historically low CD4+ cell counts, and has an undetectable viral load on standard assays?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is HIV-positive are the following criteria met: patient is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART), there is no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and has an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient known to have human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is HIV-positive are the following criteria met: patient is on a stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) that does not include strong or moderate CYP3A4 inducers or inhibitors, there is no requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections, CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and has an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: If positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), does the patient have the following? a. A stable regimen of highly active anti-retroviral therapy (HAART) b. No requirement for concurrent antibiotics or antifungal agents for the prevention of opportunistic infections c. A CD4 count above 250 cells/mcL and an undetectable HIV viral load on standard PCR-based tests.

referenceDocument.name: CITN-1
referenceDocument.doctext: HIV viral load is < 200 copies/mm3 by standard clinical assays.

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
