referenceDocument.name: Has patient received prior ch
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, targeted small molecular therapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 3 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or targeted therapies within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior targeted therapy, chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy less than or equal to 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to registration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior nitrosoureas or mitomycin C within 6 weeks prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or immunotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within half-lives (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting the study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had systemic cytotoxic chemotherapy or other targeted agents or any other investigational agents within 4 half-lives (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to starting the study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, biologic therapy or radiotherapy within 3 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: NRG_CRF Text
referenceDocument.doctext: Will the prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy be discontinued at least 4 weeks prior to starting treatment on this study ( 6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy or biologic therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or targeted small molecular therapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) or at least 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received oral targeted agents or any other investigational agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) elapsed prior to starting study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any radiotherapy or chemotherapy for their current gynecological cancer?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy immunotherapy or anticancer agents within 4 weeks (6 weeks for nitrosoureas or mitomycin C) prior to first dose of study treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Has patient failed to recover
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover to baseline or CTCAE less than or equal to grade 1 from toxicity due to all prior therapies except alopecia and other non-clinically significant AEs defined as lab elevation with no associated symptoms or sequelae?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover (less than or equal to grade 1) from adverse events due to agents administered (except for alopecia)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (to grade less than or equal to in severity) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from acute adverse events to grade less than 2 or baseline due to agents administered, with exception of alopecia, unless approved by the Protocol Chair?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from clinically significant adverse events due to prior agents administered to less than or equal to grade 1 or baseline with the exception of alopecia and peripheral neurophathy, unless approved by Protocol Chair?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover (less than or equal to grade 1 or baseline) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier (except for alopecia)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (except alopecia) due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than CTCAE Grade 1 or baseline, with the exception of alopecia)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to agents administered more than 2 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from serious adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior administered agents as noted above?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to fully recover from acute, reversible effects of prior chemotherapy regardless of interval since last treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than CTCAE Grade 1)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1, except alopecia, peripheral sensory neuropathy, and stable endocrine insufficiencies such as thyroid and adrenal insufficiency)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 4.0, grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), except alopecia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover to less than grade 1 from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from serious (CTCAE grade 3 or more) adverse events form the previously received agents?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover to eligibility levels from prior toxicity?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover to less than or equal to grade 1 from adverse events due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events (other than alopecia) due to agents administered more than 3 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from serious (CTCAE grade 3 or more) adverse events from the previously received agents?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., has residual toxicities greater than Grade 1)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover from adverse events due to prior anti-cancer therapy (i.e., have residual toxicities greater than Grade 1), with the exception of patients with less than or equal to grade 2 neuropathy or less than or equal to grade 2 alopecia who may qualify for the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient failed to recover to grade 1 or less (except alopecia) from adverse events due to agents administered more than 4 weeks earlier?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received prior biologics or immunotherapy within 28 days (or during) of romidepsin administration?

referenceDocument.name: Has the patient received any
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received any other investigational drugs?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of trametinib and during the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received any other investigational agents or participated in an investigational trial within the past 4 weeks?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is later) prior to first dose of the study regimen?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received any other investigational agent within 3 weeks prior to initiation of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: COG CRF Text 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received other investigational drugs within 2 weeks or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) prior to study enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: COG CRF Text 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had use of an investigation drug or beta adrenergic blockers, including metoprolol, sotalol, within 30 days of enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has the patient received any other investigational agents within the past 4 weeks?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any investigational agents (except ibrutinib) within 4 weeks prior to beginning treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received oral targeted agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent have elapsed prior to initiation of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received oral targeted agents, have at least 4 half-lives of the agent elapsed prior to initiation of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received investigational drug or immunotherapy (e.g. rituximab) less than or equal to 4 weeks prior to entering the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of any investigational agent at least 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of any investigational agent at least 30 days prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1 (or within 5 half-lives if the investigational product, whichever is longer)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received investigational therapy or any ancillary therapy considered investigational (utilized for a non-FDA approved indication and in the context of a research investigation) less than or equal to 4 weeks prior to registration (patients with prostate cancer are permitted to continue hormone therapy)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational drugs within 28 days (or five half-lives, whichever is shorter; with a minimum of 14 days from the last dose) preceding the first dose of trametinib and during the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other experimental drug or therapy within 21 days of baseline?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1 (or within 5 half-lives of the investigational product, whichever is longer)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received any other investigational agents within 4 weeks prior to cycle 1, day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient taken an investigational drug within 28 days or 5 half-lives (minimum 14 days), whichever is shorter, prior to randomization?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with any investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1, or five drug half-lives (whichever is longer)?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon [IFN]-a or interleukin [IL]-2) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

dataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study that address the systemic treatment of substances that stimulate the immune system as outlined in the clinical trial protocol.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon-alpha or interleukin-2) within 6 weeks or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon-a or interleukin-2) within 6 weeks or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon [IFN]-a or interleukin [IL]-2) within 6 weeks or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Has patient received treatmen
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon-? or interleukin-2) within 6 weeks or five half-lives of the drug (whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon- or interleukin-2) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon [IFN]-a or interleukin [IL]-2) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon-a or interleukin-2) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents (including, but not limited to, interferon-a or interleukin-2 [aldesleukin]) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

The non-affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medications (including, but not limited to, prednisone, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, andanti-tumor necrosis factor [anti-TNF] agents) within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day1?

instruction.text: Patients who have received acute, low dose, systemic immunosuppressant medications (e.g., a one-time dose of dexamethasone for nausea, premedication for a radiologic contrast allergy) may be enrolled. The use of inhaled corticosteroids and mineralocorticoids (e.g., fludrocortisone) for patients with orthostatic hypotension or adrenocortical insufficiency is allowed. Patients who receive low-dose supplemental corticosteroids for adrenocortical insufficiency are allowed.

dataElement.longName: Patient Immunosuppressive Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator response regarding whether a patient has meets the eligibility criteria for immunosuppressive therapy.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Patient does not require immunosuppressive doses of systemic corticosteroids (greater than 10 mg/day prednisone equivalents) for at least 2 weeks prior to study drug administration?

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have a condition
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (greater than 10 mg daily prednisone equivalents) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of study drug administration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require active systemic immunosuppressive therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any condition requiring greater than 10 mg/d prednisone equivalents?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require daily corticosteroids at high doses (prednisone greater than or equal 20 mg daily, or an equivalent) from 28 days prior to first dose and during treatment with ibrutinib?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient with autoimmune disease requiring systemic corticosteroid treatment (and previously ineligible to receive systemic immunotherapies for melanoma) not require more than 20mg of daily dose methylprednisone or its equivalent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has received treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medications (including, but not limited to, prednisone, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, and anti-tumor necrosis factor [anti-TNF] agents) was last dose a minimum of 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient on systemic corticosteroids (IV or oral steroids, excluding inhaled, topical or ophthalmic corticosteroids), or anti-epileptic drugs for treated brain metastasis, or strong CYP3A4/CYP2C19 inducers/inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medications (including, but not limited to, prednisone, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, andanti-tumor necrosis factor [anti-TNF] agents) within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient been off systemic immunosuppressive medications greater than 2 weeks prior to treatment start?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment immunosuppressive medications (including, but not limited to, prednisone, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, and anti-tumor necrosis factor [anti-TNF] agents) within 2 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient on systemic corticosteroids (IV or oral steroids, excluding inhaled, topical or ophthalmic corticosteroids), or anti-epileptic drugs for treated brain metastasis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require the use of corticosteroids to control cerebral edema or treat neurologic symptoms?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving or has received systemic immunosuppressive therapy (greater than 2 weeks) including oral steroid doses greater than 10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent within 2 months prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient been diagnosed with immunodeficiency or is receiving systemic steroid therapy or any other form of immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Was last dose of systemic corticosteroid greater than 10mg/day of Prednisone or equivalent greater than or equal to 4 weeks?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has prior treatment with systemic immunostimulatory agents, (including but not limited to interferon [IFN]-a or interleukin [IL]-2 was last dosed a minimum of 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient require daily corticosteroids at high doses (prednisone greater than or equal to 20 mg daily, or an equivalent) from 28 days prior to first dose and during treatment with ibrutinib?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient received treatment with systemic immunosuppressive medications (including, but not limited to, prednisone, cyclophosphamide, azathioprine, methotrexate, thalidomide, and anti-tumor necrosis factor [anti-TNF] agents) within 6 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient with autoimmune disease requiring systemic corticosteroid treatment (and previously ineligible to receive systemic immunotherapies for melanoma) not require more than 20mg of daily dose methylprednisone, prednisone, or its equivalent?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving systemic glucocorticoids for any purpose other than to modulate symptoms from an event of suspected immunologic etiology?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

question.questionText: Is patient taking bisphosphonate therapy for symptomatic hypercalcemia?

instruction.text: Use of bisphosphonate therapy for other reasons (e.g., bone metastasis or osteoporosis) is allowed.

dataElement.longName: Current Therapeutic Procedure Biphosphonate Administered Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether current biphosphonate therapy is being administered.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is receiving concurrent bisphosphonate treatment, was it initiated after the first dose of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Is patient receiving bisphosp
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient receiving bisphosphate treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is receiving concurrent bisphosphonate treatment was it initiated prior to the first dose of study therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Is patient taking bisphosphonate therapy for symptomatic hypercalcemia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient does not have osteoporosis, is patient receiving prophylactic treatment with bisphosphonates?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient is receiving prophylactic bisphosphonate therapy, does patient have bone disease except for osteoporosis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have brain metastases that are symptomatic or untreated or not stable for greater than or equal to 3 months (must be documented by imaging) or requiring corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has brain metastases and requires corticosteroids or non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsants, has dose of corticosteroids been stable and has been seizure free for 1 month prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have symptomatic
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic or untreated leptomeningeal or brain metastases or spinal cord compression?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases (even if treated)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have untreated brain metastases, spinal cord compression, or evidence of symptomatic brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease as noted on computed tomography (CT) or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has a history of CNS metastases, has patient received treatment and has either not had seizures or has been on stable doses of anti-seizure medicine and has had no seizures for 2 weeks?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have clinical evidence of leptomeningeal or brain metastases causing spinal cord compression that are symptomatic or untreated or not stable for greater than or equal to 3 months (must be documented by imaging) or requiring corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a primary brain tumor, active brain metastases or epidural disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has central nervous system (CNS) metastases, are they stable after therapy for CNS metastases (such as surgery, radiotherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery) for at least 3 months and is off steroid treatment for 2 weeks prior to study enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active brain metastases or leptomenigeal disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active brain metastases or epidural disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has known CNS involvement, is CNS disease cleared before treatment with Nivolumab, and there is no permanent CNS damage?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases or leptomenigeal disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active or untreated brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has a history of CNS metastases, has patient received treatment and has either not had seizures or has been on stable doses of anti-seizure medicine and has had no seizures for 4 weeks?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active CNS leukemia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic, uncontrolled brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active brain disease including symptomatic brain metastases or the presence of leptomeningeal disease, or infraterntoiral tumors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has a prior history of brain metastases, have they been treated, patient is asymptomatic from the brain metastases and corticosteroids prescribed for management of the brain metastases have been discontinued at least 7 days prior to registration?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have presence of leptomeningeal carcinomatosis, greater than 1 cm mid-line shift, uncial herniation, significant hemorrhage/hydrocephalous or history of seizure?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known or symptomatic, uncontrolled brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have leptomeningeal metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known, symptomatic/untreated brain/CNS metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases, known primary central nervous system (CNS) malignancy or symptomatic CNS metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastases or leptomeningeal carcinomatosis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known primary central nervous system (CNS) malignancy or symptomatic CNS metastases, except as noted in the protocol?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have unstable brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known primary central nervous system (CNS) malignancy or symptomatic CNS metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has asymptomatic untreated CNS disease are all of the following criteria are met: Evaluable or measurable disease outside the CNS,; No metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10 mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm); No history of intracranial hemorrhage or spinal cord hemorrhage; No ongoing requirement for dexamethasone for CNS disease; patients on a stable dose of anticonvulsants are permitted; No neurosurgical resection or brain biopsy within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 33
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known CNS metastases or seizure disorder (unless treated and stable for greater than or equal to 6 months without requirement for corticosteroids and without seizure activity)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have untreated brain metastases, spinal cord compression, or leptomeningeal carcinomatosis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 39
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have untreated brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 38
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have untreated central nervous system (CNS) involvement?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 40
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known central nervous system involvement of myeloma?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known active central nervous system (CNS) metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 42
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known active and untreated brain metastases or carcinomatous meningitis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 45
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have presence of diffuse leptomeningeal carcinomatosis, (focal /localized involvement is acceptable), greater than 1 cm mid-line shift, uncal herniation, or significant hemorrhage/hydrocephalous (small intra-lesional hemorrhage is acceptable)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 50
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known active or history of brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 52
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have clinical evidence of leptomeningeal or brain metastasis causing spinal cord compression that are symptomatic or untreated or not stable for greater than or equal to 3 months (must be documented by imaging) or requiring corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex 51
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has central nervous system (CNS) metastases, are they stable after therapy for CNS metastases (such as surgery, radiotherapy or stereotactic radiosurgery) for at least 4 weeks and is off steroid treatment for 2 weeks prior to study enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 49
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have primary brain cancers or active CNS metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 53
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have symptomatic or untreated leptomeningeal or brain metastases or spinal cord compression as documented by CT or MRI scan, analysis of cerebrospinal fluid or neurological exam?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 47
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known active or history of brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 46
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have clinical evidence of leptomeningeal or brain metastases causing spinal cord compression that are symptomatic or untreated or not stable for greater than or equal to 4 weeks (must be documented by imaging) or requiring corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 41
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known central nervous system involvement at the time of study entry?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 48
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active brain metastases?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 43
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have evidence of active disease in the central nervous system (CNS) defined as either the presence of active lesions on MRI obtained within 4 weeks of registration or progressive neurological decline?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 44
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have diffuse leptomeningeal carcinomatosis (focal/localized involvement is acceptable), greater than 1 cm mid-line shift, uncal herniation, or significant hemorrhage/hydrocephalous?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 54
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known brain metastases with progressive neurologic dysfunction, requirement of steroids and lack of improvement on head imaging obtained prior to consent to this clinical trial or carcinomatosis meningitis?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

question.questionText: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

instruction.text: Patients with past or resolved hepatitis B infection (defined as having a negative hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] test and a positive anti-HBc [antibody to hepatitis B core antigen] antibody test) are eligible. Patients positive for hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody are eligible only if polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is negative for HCV RNA.

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have clinically
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have clinically important history of liver disease, including viral or other hepatitis or cirrhosis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known, clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, orother hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has a known history of hepatitis C (HCV), do they have an undetectable viral load and any treatment received for HCV has been completed at least three weeks prior to enrollment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active hepatic or biliary disease (with exception of patients with Gilbert's syndrome, asymptomatic gallstones, liver metastases or stable chronic liver disease per investigator assessment)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have known clinically significant liver disease, including active viral, alcoholic, or other hepatitis; cirrhosis; fatty liver; and inherited liver disease?

instruction.text: Patients with a history of autoimmune hypothyroidism on a stable dose of thyroid replacement hormone may be eligible. Patients with controlled Type 1 diabetes mellitus on a stable insulin regimen may be eligible.

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have autoimmune
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history or primary immunodeficiency?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascularthrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegeners granulomatosis, Sjogrens syndrome, Bells palsy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, lichen sclerosis, or glomerulonephritis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of symptomatic disease (e.g., rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive sclerosis [scleroderma], systemic lupus erythematosus, autoimmune vasculitis [e.g., Wegener's Granulomatosis]); CNS or motor neuropathy considered of autoimmune origin (e.g., Guillain-Barre Syndrome and Myasthenia Gravis, multiple sclerosis)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegeners granulomatosis, Sjgrens syndrome, Bells palsy, Guillain-Barr syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have autoimmune diseases, including but not limited to patients with a history of immune related neurologic disease, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune (demyelinating) neuropathy, Guillain-Barre syndrome, myasthenia gravis; systemic autoimmune disease such as SLE, connective tissue diseases, scleroderma, autoimmune vasculitis, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's, ulcerative colitis, hepatitis; and patients with a history of toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN), Stevens-Johnson syndrome, or phospholipid syndrome?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active autoimmune disease, a history of known or suspected autoimmune disease or a history of a syndrome requiring systemic corticosteroids (greater than10 mg daily of prednisone equivalent) except for the treatment of malignancy with the exception of: Isolated vitiligo; resolved childhood atopy; history of a positive ANA titer without associated symptoms or history of symptoms of an autoimmune disorder; Controlled thyroid disorders; Type I diabetes mellitus; Psoriasis, Sjgren's syndrome, and arthropathies not requiring systemic treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease that threatens vital organ function, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, inflammatory bowel disease, vascularthrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener'sgranulomatosis, Guillain-Barre syndrome, multiple sclerosis, or glomerulonephritis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of active or severe autoimmune disease: Inflammatory bowel disease, including ulcerative colitis and Crohn's Disease, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic progressive scleroderma, systemic lupus erythematosis, autoimmune vasculitis (e.g., Wegeners Granulomatosis), CNS or motor neuropathy considered of autoimmune origin (e.g. Guillain-Barre Syndrome, myasthenia gravis, multiple sclerosis)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of active primary immunodeficiency?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulmatosis, Sjogren's syndrome, Bells palsy, Guillain-Barre' syndrome', multiple slerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis or glomerulonephritis?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have a history of a well-characterized and defined immune deficiency prior to the diagnosis of MF/SS or is receiving systemic steroid therapy greater than 10mg/day of Prednisone or equivalent within 4 weeks or any other form of immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days prior to the first dose of trial treatment?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13

referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any prior Grade greater than or equal to 3 immune-related adverse event (irAE) while receiving any previous immunotherapy agent, or any unresolved irAE greater than Grade 1?

referenceDocument.doctext: Did patient experienced greater than or equal to grade 3 irAE during previous treatment with one of the checkpoint inhibitors?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have unresolved toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to CTCAE v 4.0 grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia (Grade 2 or 3 toxicities from prior antitumor therapy that are considered irreversible [defined as having been present and stable for greater than 6 months], such as ifosfamide-related proteinuria, may be allowed if they are not otherwise described in the exclusion criteria AND there is agreement to allow by both the investigator and sponsor)?

referenceDocument.name: Has patient had major surgica
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation ofneed for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had any major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study with the exception of the planned breast cancer surgery that is part of the trial design?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: If patient has had major surgery, have they recovered adequately from the toxicity and/or complications from the intervention prior to starting therapy?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Is elective or planned major surgery to be performed during the course of the clinical trial?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had major surgery within 28 days of study day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had major surgery 28 days prior to day 1?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had any major surgical procedure within 4 weeks prior to randomization or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Has patient had any major surgical procedures within 4 weeks prior to randomization or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

validValue.description: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

question.questionText: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or it is anticipated that a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after last dose of atezolizumab?

instruction.text: Influenza vaccination should be given during influenza season only (approximately October to March). Patients must not receive live, attenuated influenza vaccine within 4 weeks prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or at any time during the study.

dataElement.longName: Patient Attenuated Live Virus Vaccine Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to the administration of live vaccines prepared from microorganisms which have undergone physical adaptation (e.g., by radiation or temperature conditioning) or serial passage in laboratory animal hosts or infected tissue/cell cultures, in order to produce avirulent mutant strain.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

definition.text: YES

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3

dataElement.longName: Person Uncontrolled Concurrent Disease or Disorder Exclusion Criteria Code Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/unknown indicator whether a person has an uncontrolled, concurrent disease, any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person, that would restrict entrance or bar from participation in a clinical trial.

valueDomain.longName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

referenceDocument.name: Does patient have uncontrolle
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris (Canadian Cardiovascular Society grade II-IV despite medical therapy), cardiac arrhythmia, active bleeding diatheses, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 4
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 2
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 3
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 1
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 6
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to conditions noted in the protocol that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 5
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active serious infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled diabetes, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 7
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection; symptomatic congestive heart failure; unstable angina pectoris; cardiac arrhythmia; known inadequately controlled hypertension; significant pulmonary disease including dyspnea at rest, patients requiring supplemental oxygen, or poor pulmonary reserve; or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 8
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, or cardiac arrhythmia?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 9
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to conditions noted in protocol section 3.2.3 noted below, that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 10
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to conditions noted in protocol in Section 3.4.4 as noted below, that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 11
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to: ongoing or active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics at the time of treatment initiation symptomatic congestive heart failure (requiring hospital stay within the last 6 months), myocardial infarction within the last 6 months, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 12
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have active and/or uncontrolled infections or is still recovering from an infection or actively febrile patients with uncertain etiology of febrile episode?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 13
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, hypertension, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 17
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness that would increase the risk of toxicity or limit compliance with study requirements, including but not limited to, uncontrolled serious infection requiring i.v. antibiotics at the time of registration, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, symptomatic/uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 14
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any serious intercurrent or psychiatric illness that could, in the investigator's opinion, potentially interfere with the completion of treatment according to this protocol?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 16
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, ongoing or severe infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 18
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina, previous cardiac arrhythmia or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 15
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, the following: ongoing or active infection; history of significant bleeding disorder, including congenital (von Willebrand's disease) or acquired (anti-factor VIII antibodies) disorders; large pleural effusions; or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 20
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia (including sinus bradycardia), or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 19
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any serious medical condition, uncontrolled intercurrent illness (e.g., active infection, symptomatic CHF, unstable angina, cardiac arrhythmias, laboratory abnormalities, or psychiatric illness and/or biopsychosocial conditions that may limit compliance)?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 22
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, symptomatic pulmonary disease or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 21
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled hypertension, pneumonitis, interstitial lung disease, serious chronic gastrointestinal conditions associated with diarrhea or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 24
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, interstitial lung disease or active, non-infectious pneumonitis, congestive heart failure NYHA grade greater than or equal to 3, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 25
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 23
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, symptomatic or poorly controlled cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled thrombotic or hemorrhagic disorder, or any other serious uncontrolled medical disorder in the opinion of the investigator?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 29
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness that would increase the risk of toxicity or limit compliance with study requirements, including but not limited to, ongoing uncontrolled serious infection requiring i.v. antibiotics at the time of registration, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, symptomatic/uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 27
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, myocardial infarction within 6 months, congestive heart failure, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, active cardiomyopathy, unstable ventricular arrhythmia, uncontrolled hypertension, uncontrolled psychotic disorders, serious infections, active peptic ulcer disease, active liver disease or cerebrovascular disease with previous stroke, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 28
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness that would increase the risk of toxicity or limit compliance with study requirements, including but not limited to, ongoing uncontrolled serious infection requiring IV antibiotics, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 36
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, Clinically significant bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy, including known platelet function disorders, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, clinically significant cardiac arrhythmias, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 26
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including but not limited to, active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 32
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, cognitive impairment, active substance abuse, or psychiatric illness/social situations that, in the view of the Investigator, would preclude safe treatment or the ability to give informed consent and limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 31
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any clinically significant illnesses which would compromise participation in the study, including, but not limited to active or uncontrolled infection, immune deficiencies, known HIV infection requiring protease inhibitor therapy, known Hepatitis B, known Hepatitis C, uncontrolled diabetes, uncontrolled hypertension, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, myocardial infarction within the past 6 months, uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 35
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, uncontrolled seizures, ongoing or active serious infection, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, uncontrolled diabetes, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 34
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled inter-current illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, active tuberculosis (TB), symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 30
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have any clinically significant illnesses which would compromise participation in the study, including, but not limited to active or uncontrolled infection, immune deficiencies, known HIV infection requiring protease inhibitor therapy, Hepatitis B, Hepatitis C, uncontrolled diabetes, uncontrolled hypertension, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, myocardial infarction within the past 6 months, uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?

referenceDocument.name: Theradex - 37
referenceDocument.doctext: Does patient have uncontrolled intercurrent illness including, but not limited to, ongoing or active infection, uncontrolled hypertension, symptomatic congestive heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness/social situations that would limit compliance with study requirements?
